title.narrative: Enhancing the Understanding of Displacement and Human Mobility Flows in Conflict-Affected States of North-East Nigeria

description.narrative: The crisis in conflict-affected north-east Nigeria continues to be one of the gravest in the world today, marked by armed conflict, forced displacement and severe violations of civilians' human rights and dignity. Internally displaced persons (IDPs) in and outside camps have weak coping mechanisms and are heavily reliant on humanitarian assistance to survive and improve their living conditions. Despite the efforts of the Nigerian authorities in addressing the crisis in northeast Nigeria and the increased number of humanitarian actors on the ground, the situation remains precarious in the Northeast. Through the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM), IOM is providing quarterly Mobility Tracking reports from the three conflict-affected states (Borno Adamawa, and Yobe) in Nigeria's Northeast Geopolitical Zone. As a result of the fluid displacement situation, the Emergency Tracking Tool (ETT)/Point of entry (POE) is being implemented in these states when necessary to complement the Mobility Tracking. Additionally, in several preselected camps and camp-like settings, DTM is setting up Biometric Registration assessments to assist partners with verification exercises and support other organizations with distributions.
